name: Chateau d'Isenbourg

reviews.title: What a view, what a dinner!
reviews.text: We had a standard room in the grounds of the chateau but would upgrade next time so that we had a room in the chateau itself. It is very impressive with terraces on the lawn, near the pool, a bar terrace, a breakfast terrace and a restaurant terrace. There were lots of people staying but we never felt overcrowded because of the spaciousness. The highlight of our 3 days stay was eating on the restaurant terrace, which is on a hillside overlooking the picturesque town of Rouffach. Service and food were both excellent and the setting unbelievable.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was my third and longest visit to this Chateau hotel. I still enjoy coming here. Some of the negative comments are true and it can be expensive if you don't book in advance and get a deal of some sort. This year I got a reasonable rate which included breakfast. This made good value, though the breakfast was still pricey but no more than an average hotel in England, everything was on the menu from cerials, strawberries to smoked salmon.
reviews.title: 3rd Visit

reviews.text: To eat in the restuarant is very expensive. 46, 64, 84 euros for the table d'hote. Al la carte is even more. This year the wine prices have gone through the roof. cheapest about 25 euros but the average price for an average wine 40-45 euros and you can pay over 300 euros if you wish. You don't have to eat in the restaurant though it is very good. I see it as a once in a while experience. There are other good & cheaper restaurants in nearby Rouffach.
reviews.title: Lovely Chateau in a beautiful area

likes.disliked: — The breakfast was too expensive for a poor selection

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Chateau d'Isenbourg for 3 nights in May.
reviews.title: Lovely although the price reflects that

reviews.text: Our room: We paid for a superior room and it was lovely. We had access to the roof terrace overlooking the gardens and the vineyards. The bed was large and comfortable, the furnishings nicely appointed, and the bathroom was large with a separate toilet and bidet.
reviews.title: Not the Best of its Caliber

reviews.text: The service: Maid service was good, front desk service was helpful and attentive. Restaurant service less attentive.
reviews.title: Poor Value for Money

description: Hotel Restaurant & Spa on the wine trail of Alsace, between Colmar and Mulhouse. 41 rooms of character, swimming pools ind. & out., sauna, hammam and Jacuzzi. Panoramic view. Excellent gastronomy and quality of service.
